    useDebounce

    ‚ÄúDebouncing‚Äù lets you postpone execution of a function {timeout} miliseconds after it‚Äôs last call. If a function is called again before timeout of the previous one ends, the previous function call is cancelled and new timeout is started by the last function call.

    Usage example could be a simple search input. If user strokes a key, we‚Äôd ideally want to show him actual search results each time. But in order to reduce api calls to the server, we can debounce the call so that it‚Äôs executed only after user stops writing for {timeout} miliseconds.

    Code:

    import { useCallback, useRef, useMemo } from "react";

const useDebounce = <T extends (...args: any[]) => void>(fn: T, timeout: number = 1000) => {
  const timeoutId = useRef<NodeJS.Timeout>();

  const debouncedFn: (...args: any[]) => void = useCallback(
    (...args) => {
      timeoutId.current && clearTimeout(timeoutId.current);
      timeoutId.current = setTimeout(() => fn(...args), timeout);
    },
    [fn, timeout]
  );

  const cancel = () => clearTimeout(timeoutId.current);

  return useMemo(() => ({ debouncedFn: debouncedFn as T, cancel }), [debouncedFn]);
};

export default useDebounce;
